title: BBQ Country-Style Pork Ribs - Sous Vide

Ingredients.4: 0.5 teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.5: 0.25 teaspoon five-spice powder, or to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.6: 0.25 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.7: 2 teaspoons liquid smoke flavoring, or to taste (Optional)

Ingredients.8: 0.5 cup barbecue sauce, or to taste

Directions.1: Mix salt and sugar together in a small bowl. Sprinkle all over ribs. Coat with red pepper flakes, five-spice powder, and black pepper. Slide ribs into a large vacuum-seal bag; pour in liquid smoke. Seal.

Directions.2: Immerse bag in a heat-proof container of water with a sous vide cooker. Set temperature to 140 degrees F (60 degrees C); cook for 8 hours.

Directions.3: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and turn on the broiler. Place a wire rack on top of a baking sheet.

Directions.4: Pull ribs out of the bag; spread onto the prepared baking sheet and brush with barbeque sauce.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip and continue baking until other side bubbles, 2 to 3 minutes more.
